elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Read the following questions on the types of sales arguments and tick the appropriate answer. All questions relate to the sales pitch.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Which two factors are decisive for a successful advertising argument?
choices: Credible communication and good availability of the product
Coherent communication and an attractive price-performance ratio
A broad product range and a high level of customer satisfaction
High product quality and an appealing product presentation
elements.correctAnswer: Coherent communication and an attractive price-performance ratio

elements.name: question2
elements.title: What is a possible commercial argument?
choices: Increase in productivity
Improving health
Increase creativity
Promotion of social interaction

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What is the aim of a technical argument?
choices: Explaining the argumentation technique to customers
To persuade the customer to choose the product with the highest performance
Convince customers of the technical features and functions of the product
Emphasize the technical complexity of the product
elements.correctAnswer: Convince customers of the technical features and functions of the product

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Read the following questions on the types of sales arguments and tick the appropriate answer. All questions relate to the sales pitch.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Which of the following statements is NOT a quality argument?
choices: The product meets the needs and expectations of customers.
The product is made from high-quality materials.
The product is inexpensive and affordable.
The product complies with the applicable quality standards.
elements.correctAnswer: The product is inexpensive and affordable.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: What is the aim of a utility argument?
choices: Convince customers of the aesthetic qualities of the product
Convince customers that the product has a functional benefit
To show the customer that the product meets her individual needs
Getting the customer to buy the product for emotional reasons
elements.correctAnswer: Convince customers that the product has a functional benefit

elements.name: question6
elements.title: What is the function of emotional arguments?
choices: Emotional arguments are used to explain the content of the product or service.
Emotional arguments have no function in a sales pitch.
Emotional arguments are used to convince customers with technical information and specifications.
Emotional arguments aim to address the needs, desires and personal values of the customer and create an emotional connection.
elements.correctAnswer: Emotional arguments aim to address the needs, desires and personal values of the customer and create an emotional connection.
